channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As drinks targeting kids have soared, there's new guidance on what's healthy
item.description: As highly caffeinated energy drinks have become popular with kids, a coalition of health organizations has new guidelines on what's a healthy beverage. Some of the advice may surprise parents.
item.content:encoded:
As highly caffeinated energy drinks have become popular with kids, a coalition of health organizations has new guidelines on what's a healthy beverage. Some of the advice may surprise parents.

(Image credit: Radevich Tatiana)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: 3 Israeli and 5 Thai hostages freed in Gaza in exchange for Palestinian prisoners
item.description: The exchange is part of a deal between Israel and Hamas that will see a total of 33 hostages returned to Israel in exchange for around 1,900 Palestinian prisoners and detainees.
item.content:encoded:
The exchange is part of a deal between Israel and Hamas that will see a total of 33 hostages returned to Israel in exchange for around 1,900 Palestinian prisoners and detainees.

(Image credit: Mostafa Alkharouf)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: After fires, LA students yearn to get back to school, and a normal life
item.description: The historic fires in Los Angeles meant many students lost homes, schools, or both. Now, as some schools reopen, families are trying to find routine.
item.content:encoded:
The historic fires in Los Angeles meant many students lost homes, schools, or both. Now, as some schools reopen, families are trying to find routine.

(Image credit: Jireh Deng for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Trans community fears Trump's actions will upend legal precedent on prison protections
item.description: One of President Trump's first executive orders impacts transgender inmates incarcerated in federal facilities. It's just one in a series of actions signed by Trump that target the trans community.
item.content:encoded:
One of President Trump's first executive orders impacts transgender inmates incarcerated in federal facilities. It's just one in a series of actions signed by Trump that target the trans community.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Jesse Eisenberg isn't ambitious â€” but he does worry about failing
item.description: Actor, writer and director Jesse Eisenberg says he has had more failures than successes. In this week's Wild Card, he opens up about ambition and his his defense against despair.
item.content:encoded:
Actor, writer and director Jesse Eisenberg says he has had more failures than successes. In this week's Wild Card, he opens up about ambition and his his defense against despair.

(Image credit: Gareth Cattermole)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Trump's pick for intel chief, Tulsi Gabbard, faces her confirmation hearing
item.description: Among the topics likely to come up at the hearing: her 2017 meeting with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, her friendly positions toward Russia and her push to drop charges against Edward Snowden.
item.content:encoded:
Among the topics likely to come up at the hearing: her 2017 meeting with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, her friendly positions toward Russia and her push to drop charges against Edward Snowden.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: Trump's FBI director pick, Kash Patel, faces confirmation hearing
item.description: Kash Patel, President Trump's pick to run the FBI, answers questions Thursday in a public hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee.
item.content:encoded:
Kash Patel, President Trump's pick to run the FBI, answers questions Thursday in a public hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Christie Dashiell became a musician at school. Then, she became an artist
item.description: Reflecting on a transformative residency program, the jazz vocalist now nominated for her first Grammy Award says her album Journey in BlackÂ reflects "the expansiveness of the Black experience."
item.content:encoded:
Reflecting on a transformative residency program, the jazz vocalist now nominated for her first Grammy Award says her album Journey in BlackÂ reflects "the expansiveness of the Black experience."

(Image credit: Jared Soares for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Patrick Jarenwattananon

item.title: Trump's pulling a U-turn on EVs, but not much has changed â€” yet
item.description: President Trump has charted a new course for electric vehicle policy in the U.S. While the direction is clear, the details aren't.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has charted a new course for electric vehicle policy in the U.S. While the direction is clear, the details aren't.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Criminal records of Jan. 6 rioters pardoned by Trump include rape, domestic violence
item.description: Dozens of Jan. 6 defendants who received pardons from President Trump had past criminal convictions for charges including rape, manslaughter, domestic violence and drug trafficking.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of Jan. 6 defendants who received pardons from President Trump had past criminal convictions for charges including rape, manslaughter, domestic violence and drug trafficking.

(Image credit: Julio Cortez)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach
